doc.field: Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad Company lease
Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad Company lease
A lease of tracks to the Grand Street, Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad Company, dated 1881.
A lease of tracks to the Grand Street, Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad Company, dated 1881.
Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad Company
Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad Company
Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad Company
A lease of tracks to the Grand Street, Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad Company, dated 1881.

The Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad was organized in 1876 and merged with the Coney Island Railroad in 1891. The Grand Street, Prospect Park and Flatbush Railroad was organized in 1870 and foreclosed in 1887. Both companies were controlled by Loftis Wood at the time of the lease agreement.
